intro: Solanum honopuense, commonly known as the Honopu nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are berries that mature to a dark purple color, and the plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within the nightshade family.
